events.description: Responsible for developing a cohesive European Energy Policy, focusing on environmental considerations, limiting energy demand growth, and increasing supply diversity.
supporting_quotes: In 2009, Andris Piebalgs received the 'Diamond Prize' from the Regional Chamber of Commerce in Katowice (Poland) for his work in developing a cohesive European Energy Policy for the further generations.

On 15 November 2004 when questioned by the European Parliament as the Commissioner Designate for Energy, Piebalgs stressed the importance of environmental considerations in energy policy, and announced his intention to pursue a policy framework based on limiting growth in demand for energy while increasing diversity of supply.
